intro: Hackelia patula, commonly known as the slender honeysuckle, is a perennial flowering plant native to North America. It produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, arranged in clusters along the stems. The plant has slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves with slightly serrated edges. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Hackelia patula is valued in gardens for its ornamental flowers and is also used in ecological restoration projects.
